CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the solid state , the planarity effect and interchain stacking of PffBB-n caused the bathochromic shift of the absorption cut - off to ∼ 780 nm , corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV. Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time. Figure 2 displays the optimized molecular conformation and the frontier molecular orbitals of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n. The dihedral angle between the BDT electron - donating unit and the electron - deficient unit was found to be ∼ 26.9 ° in the optimized structure , which is caused by the ethyl substitution on the thienyl ring. The HOMO delocalizes extensively over the π-conjugation framework , whereas the LUMO mainly populated on the benzothiadiazole Article unit. Such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer. The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry. Their results are summarized in Table 2 , and the respective energy levels are delineated in Figure 2d. The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential to be -5.66 , -5.73 , -5.72 , and -5.78 eV , respectively. The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively. As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM. Such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM , which is important to achieve a large V oc of a solar device. As a result , BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance. X-Ray Diffraction ( XRD ). X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers and the XRD spectra are shown in Figure 3. Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached , polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns. The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing ( d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones , whereas the broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBB-n polymer
2. B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) basis set
3. Ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n
4. BDT electron - donating unit
5. Electron - deficient unit
6. Thienyl ring
7. Benzothiadiazole Article unit
8. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbitals)
9. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbitals)
10. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
11. PC71BM
12. XRD (X-Ray Diffraction)
13. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n polymer |
| Ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n |
| BDT electron - donating unit |
| Electron - deficient unit |
| Thienyl ring |
| Benzothiadiazole Article unit |
| ITO |
| PC71BM |
| PffBB-10 |
| PffBB-12 |
| PffBB-14 |
| PffBB-16 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n polymer |
| Ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n |
| BDT electron - donating unit |
| Electron - deficient unit |
| Thienyl ring |
| Benzothiadiazole Article unit |
| ITO |
| PC71BM |

| PffBB-14 |

The "B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) basis set" is a computational method and set of basis functions used in DFT calculations and is not a material. Therefore, it should not be included in the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the solid state , the planarity effect and interchain stacking of PffBB-n caused the bathochromic shift of the absorption cut - off to ∼ 780 nm , corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV. Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time. Figure 2 displays the optimized molecular conformation and the frontier molecular orbitals of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n. The dihedral angle between the BDT electron - donating unit and the electron - deficient unit was found to be ∼ 26.9 ° in the optimized structure , which is caused by the ethyl substitution on the thienyl ring. The HOMO delocalizes extensively over the π-conjugation framework , whereas the LUMO mainly populated on the benzothiadiazole Article unit. Such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer. The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry. Their results are summarized in Table 2 , and the respective energy levels are delineated in Figure 2d. The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential to be -5.66 , -5.73 , -5.72 , and -5.78 eV , respectively. The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively. As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM. Such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM , which is important to achieve a large V oc of a solar device. As a result , BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance. X-Ray Diffraction ( XRD ). X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers and the XRD spectra are shown in Figure 3. Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached , polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns. The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing ( d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones , whereas the broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Let's think step by step.

1. Bathochromic shift of absorption cut-off: This is a property that describes the red shift of the absorption edge of the PffBB-n polymer in the solid state.
2. Optical band gap: This is a property that describes the energy difference between the valence band and the conduction band of the PffBB-n polymer, which is responsible for its optical absorption.
3. Dihedral angle between BDT electron-donating unit and electron-deficient unit: This is a property that describes the angle between two units in the optimized structure of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n.
4. Frontier molecular orbitals: These are the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n.
5. HOMO energy levels: These are the energies of the highest occupied molecular orbitals of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16.
6. LUMO energy levels: These are the energies of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbitals of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16.
7. Energy levels of donor polymers and PC71BM: These are the energies of the HOMO and LUMO levels of PffBB-n polymers and PC71BM, respectively.
8. Voc of a solar device: This is the voltage output of a solar device.
9. XRD patterns: These are the patterns obtained from X-ray diffraction measurements of PffBB-n polymers.
10. In-plane spacing (d1-spacing): This is a property that describes the distance between the polymer backbones in the plane of the crystal.
11. π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing): This is a property that describes the distance between the polymer backbones in the direction perpendicular to the plane of the crystal.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Bathochromic shift of absorption cut-off |
| Optical band gap |
| Dihedral angle between BDT electron-donating unit and electron-deficient unit |
| Frontier molecular orbitals (HOMO, LUMO) |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| Energy levels of donor polymers and PC71BM |
| Voc of a solar device |
| XRD patterns |
| In-plane spacing (d1-spacing) |
| π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing) |

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Optical band gap |
| Dihedral angle between BDT electron-donating unit and electron-deficient unit |
| Frontier molecular orbitals (HOMO, LUMO) |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| XRD patterns |
| In-plane spacing (d1-spacing) |
| π-π stacking distance (d2-spacing) |

* B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set
* Repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone
* All of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups
* Figure 2 displays
* The optimized molecular conformation
* The frontier molecular orbitals of the ethyl-substituted repeating units
* The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry
* Their results are summarized in Table 2
* The respective energy levels are delineated in Figure 2d
* The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential
* The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films
* Such energy level alignment
* As a result, BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance
* X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers
* Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached
* The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing (d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones
* The broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the solid state , the planarity effect and interchain stacking of PffBB-n caused the bathochromic shift of the absorption cut - off to ∼ 780 nm , corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV. Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time. Figure 2 displays the optimized molecular conformation and the frontier molecular orbitals of the ethyl-substituted repeating units of PffBB-n. The dihedral angle between the BDT electron - donating unit and the electron - deficient unit was found to be ∼ 26.9 ° in the optimized structure , which is caused by the ethyl substitution on the thienyl ring. The HOMO delocalizes extensively over the π-conjugation framework , whereas the LUMO mainly populated on the benzothiadiazole Article unit. Such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer. The electrochemical properties of PffBB-n were determined by cyclic voltammetry. Their results are summarized in Table 2 , and the respective energy levels are delineated in Figure 2d. The HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 were estimated from the onset oxidation potential to be -5.66 , -5.73 , -5.72 , and -5.78 eV , respectively. The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively. As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM. Such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM , which is important to achieve a large V oc of a solar device. As a result , BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance. X-Ray Diffraction ( XRD ). X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers and the XRD spectra are shown in Figure 3. Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached , polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns. The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing ( d 1spacing ) between the polymer backbones , whereas the broad peaks lying above 20 ° ( d 2 -spacing ) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance.

Let's think step by step.

1. Bathochromic shift of absorption cut-off: ∼ 780 nm (approximately 780 nanometers)
2. Optical band gap: ∼ 1.61 eV (approximately 1.61 electron volts)
3. Dihedral angle between BDT electron-donating unit and electron-deficient unit: ∼ 26.9 ° (approximately 26.9 degrees)
4. HOMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16:
   - PffBB-10: -5.66 eV
   - PffBB-12: -5.73 eV
   - PffBB-14: -5.72 eV
   - PffBB-16: -5.78 eV
5. LUMO energy levels of PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, and PffBB-16:
   - PffBB-10: -4.01 eV
   - PffBB-12: -4.11 eV
   - PffBB-14: -4.11 eV
   - PffBB-16: -4.16 eV
6. HOMO energy level of ITO: N/A
7. LUMO energy level of PC71BM: N/A

The following entities were removed as they do not clearly refer to a material property:

* "corresponding to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.61 eV" (optical band gap is already a property value)
* "which is caused by the ethyl substitution on the thienyl ring" (dihedral angle is a property value)
* "such frontier molecular orbital electron distribution would greatly enhance efficient intramolecular charge transfer" (this statement describes the effect of the frontier molecular orbital electron distribution, not a property value)
* "Their results are summarized in Table 2" (this statement refers to the electrochemical properties data, not a property value)
* "As a result, the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO" and "such energy level alignment would facilitate charge transfer from the donor polymer to the PC71BM acceptor and provide a relatively large difference between the HOMO energy level of donor polymers and the LUMO level of PC71BM" (these statements describe the relationship between the energy levels of different materials, not property values of PffBB-n polymers)
* "BHJ PSCs fabricated from these polymers are promising to achieve high device performance" (this statement describes the potential application of the polymers, not a property value)
* "X-ray diffraction measurements were carried out to determine the crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers" (crystallinity is a property value, but the values were not provided in the paragraph)
* "Despite various sizes of alkyl side chains attached, polymers with the same backbone show very similar XRD patterns" (this statement describes the similarity of XRD patterns, not a property value)
* "The sharp peaks at around 5 ° correspond to the in-plane spacing (d 1-spacing) between the polymer backbones" and "the broad peaks lying above 20 ° (d 2-spacing) is characterized as a π-π stacking distance" (d 1-spacing and d 2-spacing are property values, but the values were not provided in the paragraph)
